javadoc:
Abstract base class for creating dockable GUI components within a tool.

The one method that must be implemented is {@link #getComponent()} which is where the top level Swing JComponent is returned to be docked into the tool. Typically, the GUI components are created in the constructor along with any local actions for the provider. The getComponent() method then simply returns the top level component previously created by this provider.

There are many other methods for configuring how to dock the component, set title information, configure grouping, set the help, add actions, and receive show/hide notifications, some of which are highlighted below. Typically, implementers will use these methods to configure how the GUI component behaves within the tool, and then add the business logic that uses and reacts to the GUI components created in this provider.

To effectively use this class you merely need to create your component, add your actions to this class ({@link #addLocalAction(DockingActionIf)}) and then add this provider to the tool ({@link #addToTool()}).

This also provides several useful convenience methods:

  • {@link #addLocalAction(DockingActionIf)}
  • {@link #addToTool()}
  • {@link #setVisible(boolean)}
  • {@link #setTitle(String)}
  • {@link #setIcon(Icon)}

There are a handful of stub methods that can be overridden as desired:

  • {@link #componentActivated()} and {@link #componentDeactived()}
  • {@link #componentHidden()} and {@link #componentShown()}

Show Provider Action - Each provider has an action to show the provider. For typical, non-transient providers (see {@link #setTransient()}) the action will appear in the tool's Window menu. You can have your provider also appear in the tool's toolbar by calling {@link #addToTool()}.

Historical Note: This class was created so that implementors could add local actions within the constructor without having to understand that they must first add themselves to the WindowManager.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Creates a new component provider with a default location of WindowPosition#WINDOW.

params.name: tool
params.comment: The tool will manage and show this provider

params.name: name
params.comment:
The providers name.  This is used to group similar providers into a tab within
        the same window.

params.name: owner
params.comment: The owner of this provider, usually a plugin name.

The providers name.  This is used to group similar providers into a tab within

the type of context supported by this provider; may be null (see

methods.javadoc:
A method that allows children to set the instanceID to a desired value (useful for restoring saved IDs).

Note: this can be called only once during the lifetime of the calling instance; otherwise, an {@link AssertException} will be thrown. @param newID the new ID of this provider
methods.name: initializeInstanceID
methods.comment:
A method that allows children to set the instanceID to a desired value (useful for
 restoring saved IDs).
 
 Note: this can be called only once during the lifetime of the calling instance; otherwise, an 
 AssertException will be thrown.

params.name: newID
params.comment: the new ID of this provider

methods.javadoc:
A unique ID for this provider
@return unique ID for this provider

methods.javadoc:
Adds this provider to the tool in a new window that is not initially visible.  The provider
 will then show up in the "Windows" menu of the tool
methods.name: addToTool
methods.comment:
Adds this provider to the tool in a new window that is not initially visible.  The provider
 will then show up in the "Windows" menu of the tool

methods.javadoc: Removes this provider from the tool.

methods.comment: Removes this provider from the tool.

Adds the given action to the system and associates it with this provider.
@param action The action to add.

methods.comment: Adds the given action to the system and associates it with this provider.

params.comment: The action to add.

methods.javadoc:
Removes the given action from the system.
@param action The action to remove.
methods.name: removeLocalAction
methods.comment: Removes the given action from the system.

params.name: action
params.comment: The action to remove.

methods.javadoc:
Convenience method to show or hide this provider.
@param visible True shows the provider; false hides the provider
methods.name: setVisible
methods.comment: Convenience method to show or hide this provider.

params.name: visible
params.comment: True shows the provider; false hides the provider

methods.name: getContextType
methods.comment:
A signal used when installing actions.  Some actions are only added to a given window 
 if there is a provider in that window that can work with that action.  Providers can return
 a context class from this method to control whether dependent actions get added.  Most
 providers return null for this method, which means they will not have any dependent 
 actions added to windows other than the primary application window.

return.comment: a class representing the desired context type or null;

methods.javadoc:
Convenience method to indicate if this provider is showing.
@return true if this provider is showing.
methods.name: isVisible
methods.comment: Convenience method to indicate if this provider is showing.

return.comment: true if this provider is showing.

methods.javadoc:
Convenience method to indicate if this provider is the active provider (has focus)
@return true if this provider is active.
methods.name: isActive
methods.comment: Convenience method to indicate if this provider is the active provider (has focus)

return.comment: true if this provider is active.

methods.javadoc:
This is the callback that will happen when the user presses the 'X' button of a provider. Transient providers will be removed from the tool completely. Non-transient providers will merely be hidden.

Subclasses may override this method to prevent a provider from being closed; for example, if an editor has unsaved changes, then this method could prevent the close from happening.
methods.name: closeComponent
methods.comment:
This is the callback that will happen when the user presses the 'X' button of a provider.
 Transient providers will be removed from the tool completely.   Non-transient providers
 will merely be hidden.
 
 Subclasses may override this method to prevent a provider from being closed; for 
 example, if an editor has unsaved changes, then this method could prevent the close from
 happening.

methods.javadoc: Notifies the component provider that it is now the active provider

methods.comment: Notifies the component provider that it is now the active provider

methods.javadoc: Notifies the component provider that it is no longer the active provider

methods.comment: Notifies the component provider that it is no longer the active provider

Notifies the provider that the component is being hidden.  This happens when the 
 provider is being closed.

methods.comment:
Notifies the provider that the component is being hidden.  This happens when the 
 provider is being closed.

methods.javadoc: Notifies the provider that the component is being shown.
methods.name: componentShown
methods.comment: Notifies the provider that the component is being shown.

 May be null for key-stroke or other non-mouse event.

popup event which corresponds to this request.

params.comment: the provider-specific context object

methods.comment: Kicks the tool to let it know the context for this provider has changed.

Returns the general HelpLocation for this provider.  Should return null only if no 
 help documentation exists.

Sets the provider's sub-title (Sub-titles don't show up

Sets the text to be displayed on tabs when provider is stacked with other providers.

Returns the provider's current title.
@return the provider's current title.
methods.name: getTitle
methods.comment: Returns the provider's current title.

methods.name: getSubTitle
methods.comment:
Returns the provider's current sub-title (Sub-titles don't show up
 in the window menu).

methods.name: getTabText
methods.comment:
Returns the optionally set text to display in the tab for a component provider.   The
 text returned from #getTitle() will be used by default.

return.comment: the optionally set text to display in the tab for a component provider.

methods.comment:
Sets the default key binding that will show this provider when pressed.   This value can
 be changed by the user and saved as part of the Tool options.

params.name: kbData
params.comment: the key binding

Convenience method for setting the provider's icon
@param icon the icon to use for this provider

Signals that this provider's action for showing the provider should appear in the main 
 toolbar

Signals that this provider's action for showing the provider should appear in the main 
 toolbar

methods.javadoc:
Returns the name of a cascading sub-menu name to use when when showing this provider in the
 "Window" menu. If the group name is null, the item will appear in the top-level menu.
@return the menu group for this provider or null if this provider should appear in the
 top-level menu.
methods.name: getWindowSubMenuName
methods.comment:
Returns the name of a cascading sub-menu name to use when when showing this provider in the
 "Window" menu. If the group name is null, the item will appear in the top-level menu.

return.comment:
the menu group for this provider or null if this provider should appear in the
 top-level menu.

methods.name: isTransient
methods.comment:
Returns true if this component goes away during a user session (most providers remain in
 the tool all session long, visible or not)

methods.name: isSnapshot
methods.comment:
A special marker that indicates this provider is a snapshot of a primary provider, 
 somewhat like a picture of the primary provider.

methods.javadoc:
Sets this class to be transient.  Setting this provider to be transient will cause
 this provider to be removed from the tool when the corresponding window is closed.
methods.name: setTransient
methods.comment:
Sets this class to be transient.  Setting this provider to be transient will cause
 this provider to be removed from the tool when the corresponding window is closed.

methods.javadoc: Sets the window menu group. If the window menu group is null, the corresponding window menu item will appear in the root menu, otherwise it will appear in a sub-menu named group. @param group the name of the window's sub-menu for this provider
methods.name: setWindowMenuGroup
methods.comment:
Sets the window menu group.  If the window menu group is null, the corresponding window menu
 item will appear in the root menu, otherwise it will appear in a 
 sub-menu named group.

params.name: group
params.comment: the name of the window's sub-menu for this provider

methods.javadoc:
The initial {@link WindowPosition} of this provider.  If a {@link #getWindowGroup() window
 group} is provided, then this position is relative to that provider.  Otherwise, this 
 position is relative to the tool window.
@return The initial {@link WindowPosition} of this provider.
methods.name: getDefaultWindowPosition
methods.comment:
The initial WindowPosition of this provider.  If a #getWindowGroup() is provided, then this position is relative to that provider.  Otherwise, this 
 position is relative to the tool window.

return.comment: The initial WindowPosition of this provider.

methods.name: setDefaultWindowPosition
methods.comment:
Sets the default position of this provider when being shown for the first time.  If the
 providers position in the tool has been saved before, then this value is ignored.

params.name: windowPosition
params.comment: the position

methods.javadoc:
The position of this provider when being placed with other members of the same group. As an example, assume this provider is being shown for the first time while there is another member of its {@link #getWindowGroup() window group} already visible. Further, assume that this method will return {@link WindowPosition#STACK}. This provider will then be stacked upon the already showing provider.

To determine where this provider should be initially shown, see {@link #getDefaultWindowPosition()}. @return The position of this provider when being placed with other members of the same group.
methods.name: getIntraGroupPosition
methods.comment:
The position of this provider when being placed with other members of the same group.  As
 an example, assume this provider is being shown for the first time while there is another
 member of its #getWindowGroup() already visible.  Further, assume 
 that this method will return WindowPosition#STACK.  This provider will then be
 stacked upon the already showing provider.
 
 To determine where this provider should be initially shown, 
 see #getDefaultWindowPosition().

return.comment: The position of this provider when being placed with other members of the same group.

methods.javadoc:
See {@link #getIntraGroupPosition()}.
@param position the new position
methods.name: setIntraGroupPosition
methods.comment: See #getIntraGroupPosition().

params.name: position
params.comment: the new position

methods.javadoc:
Returns an optional group designator that, if non-null, the docking window manager uses to determine the initial location of the new component relative to any existing instances of this component Provider.

The docking window manager will use {@link #getIntraGroupPosition() Intra-group Position} to decide where to place this provider inside of the already open instances of the same group. The default position is 'stack', which results in the new instance being stacked with other instances of this provider that have the same group unless that instance is the active provider or is currently stacked with the active provider. (This is to prevent new windows from covering the active window). @return the window group
methods.name: getWindowGroup
methods.comment:
Returns an optional group designator that, if non-null, the docking window manager uses to 
 determine the initial location of the new component relative to any existing instances
 of this component Provider.  
 
 The docking window manager will use #getIntraGroupPosition()  
 to decide where to place this provider inside of the already open instances of the 
 same group.  The default position is 'stack', which results in the new instance being
 stacked with other instances of this provider that have the same group unless that instance is
 the active provider or is currently stacked with the active provider. (This is to prevent
 new windows from covering the active window).

methods.javadoc:
Sets the window group.  See {@link #getWindowGroup()}.
@param group the group for this provider.
methods.name: setWindowGroup
methods.comment: Sets the window group.  See #getWindowGroup().

params.name: group
params.comment: the group for this provider.

methods.name: getMappedOwner
methods.comment: Returns any registered new provider name for the oldName/oldOwner pair.

params.name: oldOwner
params.comment: the old owner name

params.name: oldName
params.comment: the old provider name

return.comment: the new provider name for that oldOwner/oldName

methods.name: getMappedName
methods.comment: Returns any registered new provider owner for the oldName/oldOwner pair.

params.name: oldOwner
params.comment: the old owner name

params.name: oldName
params.comment: the old provider name

return.comment: the new provider owner for that oldOwner/oldName

methods.name: registerProviderNameOwnerChange
methods.comment:
Register a name and/or owner change to a provider so that old tools can restore those 
 provider windows to their old position and size. Note you must supply all four 
 arguments. If the name or owner did not change, use the name or owner that did not change 
 for both the old and new values.
 
 Note: when you make use of this method, please signal when it is safe to remove 
 its usage.

params.name: oldName
params.comment: the old name of the provider.

params.name: oldOwner
params.comment: the old owner of the provider.

params.name: newName
params.comment: the new name of the provider. If the name did not change, use the old name here.

params.name: newOwner
params.comment: the new owner of the provider. If the owner did not change, use the old owner here.

name: ComponentProvider
comment:
Abstract base class for creating dockable GUI components within a tool.  
 
 The one method that must be implemented is #getComponent() which is where the top level
 Swing JComponent is returned to be docked into the tool.  Typically, the GUI components are
 created in the constructor along with any local actions for the provider.  The getComponent() 
 method then simply returns the top level component previously created by this provider.
 
 There are many other methods for configuring how to dock the component, set title information,
 configure grouping, set the help, add actions, and receive show/hide notifications, some
 of which are highlighted below.  Typically, implementers will use these methods to configure
 how the GUI component behaves within the tool, and then add the business logic that uses and reacts
 to the GUI components created in this provider.
 
 To effectively use this class you merely need to create your component, add your actions to 
 this class (#addLocalAction(DockingActionIf)) and then add this provider to the tool
 (#addToTool()).
 
 This also provides several useful convenience methods:
 
  #addLocalAction(DockingActionIf)
  #addToTool()
  #setVisible(boolean)  
  #setTitle(String)
  #setIcon(Icon)
 
 
 There are a handful of stub methods that can be overridden as desired:
 
  #componentActivated() and #componentDeactived()
  #componentHidden() and #componentShown()
 
 
 
 Show Provider Action - Each provider has an action to show the provider.  For
 typical, non-transient providers (see #setTransient()) the action will appear in 
 the tool's Window menu.   You can have your provider also appear in the tool's toolbar
 by calling #addToTool().
 
 Historical Note: This class was created so that implementors could add local actions within the constructor
 without having to understand that they must first add themselves to the WindowManager.

fields.name: TRANSIENT_PROVIDER_TOOLBAR_WARNING_MESSAGE
fields.constant_value: "Transient providers are not added to the toolbar"

fields.javadoc: True if this provider's action should appear in the toolbar
fields.name: addToolbarAction
fields.comment: True if this provider's action should appear in the toolbar
